items.title: Dividend Champion, Contender, And Challenger Highlights: Week Of April 13
items.description: Read here for highlights on recent and upcoming dividend related activity for dividend stocks on the Dividend Champions list.

items.title: Trump And Xi Jinping's Tariff Threats May Be 'Just For The LOLz,' Says Analyst: 'It's Not Like This Is A Great Financial Crisis'
items.author: Ananya Gairola
items.description: An analyst downplays the long-term impact of escalating U.S.-China tariff rhetoric, suggesting that the latest threats may be largely symbolic and unlikely to result in sustained economic disruption.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: Apple relies heavily on Chinese manufacturing for most of its products, placing it squarely in the crosshairs of ongoing trade tensions.
Carrier Global leads China's commercial HVAC market with extensive operations, making it vulnerable to the impact of trade tensions.
Ford Motor Co. tops the list of major U.S. public companies most overexposed to China, scoring high across various risk categories.

Tesla's U.S. energy division risks soaring costs from tariffs on Chinese battery cells, potentially doubling Powerwall and Megapack production expenses.
Coca-Cola is facing cost pressures from tariffs on key ingredients like sucralose, which may impact profitability.
Cummins maintains deep ties to China through joint ventures and clean energy initiatives, making it vulnerable to trade tensions.
RTX Corp. has thousands of Chinese suppliers and has admitted that decoupling is unfeasible.
Honeywell has begun adding surcharges due to tariff-related supply disruptions.
Disney's CEO has raised alarms about the broader impact of tariffs.
Caterpillar is confronting shrinking competitiveness as Chinese buyers turn to alternative suppliers.
